  physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang. It is decorated with floral motifs. On the broad vertical panel on the right
 there is a large bouquet of flowers against a dark blue background. The main body of the kain panjang features repeated patterns of flowers and curling tendrils against a light cream background. There is a signature on the bottom-right of the batik kain panjang.

  subject_terms_1: Peranakan flower (motif) foliage (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Batik

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes Batik

  sgcool_label_text: The broad vertical panel of this kain panjang or kepala is decorated with a large bouquet of flowers
 also known as the buketan motif.  On the main design feature of this cloth (badan)
 repeated patterns of flowers and curling tendrils are set against a cream background.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987)
 the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures
 she used her husband’s name
 Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards
 she used Jane Hendromartono
 combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name
 Hendromartono with Jane
 as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother
 and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds
 rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe
 America and Japan
 especially in the 1980s. This piece is signed “Jane Hendromartono Pekalongan Java”.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang. It is decorated with floral motifs. On the broad vertical panel on the right, there is a large bouquet of flowers against a dark blue background. The main body of the kain panjang features repeated patterns of flowers and curling tendrils against a light cream background. There is a signature on the bottom-right of the batik kain panjang.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Motifs Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Batik
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The broad vertical panel of this kain panjang or kepala is decorated with a large bouquet of flowers, also known as the buketan motif.  On the main design feature of this cloth (badan), repeated patterns of flowers and curling tendrils are set against a cream background.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s. This piece is signed “Jane Hendromartono Pekalongan Java”.
